thread.title: SANS Institute to Host the Fourth Annual NetWars Tournament of Champions Competition in Conjunction with the Cyber Defense Initiative Training Event in Washington D.C.
thread.title_full: SANS Institute to Host the Fourth Annual NetWars Tournament of Champions Competition in Conjunction with the Cyber Defense Initiative Training Event in Washington D.C.

author: admin
title: SANS Institute to Host the Fourth Annual NetWars Tournament of Champions Competition in Conjunction with the Cyber Defense Initiative Training Event in Washington D.C.
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/5/2015 @ 8:47 AM Companies mentioned in this article: SANS Institute 
BETHESDA, Md., Oct. 5, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- SANS Institute, the global leader in information security training, today announced the Fourth Annual NetWars Tournament of Champions Competition. The competition will be held in conjunction with the SANS Cyber Defense Initiative (CDI) 2015 security training event in Washington, D.C. taking place December 12 - 19. 
One of the key competitions in the U.S. Cyber Challenge, NetWars is an in-depth learning tool for security professionals. Participants will compete in a mock environment to test their defensive, analysis, and offensive cyber skills, fighting off intruders while trying to take over target systems and networks. 
"This year, we've really amped up the NetWars Tournament of Champions. As we pit the best of the best against each other, they will be faced with all new challenges featuring mobile device attacks (exploiting Android and more), a brand new narrative (save Frodo from Mordor), and a whole lot more. It will be very exciting for all involved," said Ed Skoudis, Director of SANS NetWars. 
SANS Cyber Defense Initiative 2015 will feature hands-on, immersion style training courses for InfoSec professionals at every level. Attendees will learn how the newest cyber attacks work and what can be done to prevent them or mitigate the damage. They will also learn about the latest tools, and how to use them, for finding, blocking and deciphering hacking attacks. 
For additional information on the NetWars Tournaments Dec. 17-18, a list of courses, or to register for SANS CDI, please visit: www.sans.org/u/8L1 
About SANS Institute The SANS Institute was established in 1989 as a cooperative research and education organization. SANS is the most trusted and, by far, the largest provider of cyber security training and certification to professionals at governments and commercial institutions world-wide. Renowned SANS instructors teach over 50 different courses at more than 200 live cyber security training events as well as online. GIAC, an affiliate of the SANS Institute, validates employee qualifications via 27 hands-on, technical certifications in information security . The SANS Technology Institute, a regionally accredited independent subsidiary, offers master's degrees in cyber security . SANS offers a myriad of free resources to the InfoSec community including consensus projects, research reports, and newsletters; it also operates the Internet's early warning system--the Internet Storm Center. At the heart of SANS are the many security practitioners, representing varied global organizations from corporations to universities, working together to help the entire information security community. ( www.SANS.org ) 
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/sans-institute-to-host-the-fourth-annual-netwars-tournament-of-champions-competition-in-conjunction-with-the-cyber-defense-initiative-training-event-in-washington-dc-300154111.html 
SOURCE SANS Institute
